attributes.action: Enact Carbon Dividend: comprising a carbon fee with a dividend back to people
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the EU, the UK is involved in pricing carbon via the EU emissions trading system (EU ETS).

But 58% of emissions are out of scope of the EU ETS. They originate in transport, buildings, waste management and agriculture.

With a carbon fee, emitters pay for environmental cost and so manage their carbon output.

Parliament needs to consider a wider comprehensive carbon fee and to distribute that fee in a fair and equitable manner.

https://www.thendobetter.com/investing/carbon-tax
attributes.background:
A fee on all carbon is an effective way to reduce GHG emissions. A dividend given back to the people would help distributive justice as the lower paid benefit more. A portion of the dividend could fund innovation.

Left & Right wing Economists agree carbon fees are strong incentive to decarbonise.
